title: How to prepare for a new normal university activity due to COVID-19 pandemics - Quora

response.answer_text: I think what you mean is how to protect yourself during your university activity. Here are my recommendations: How to avoid contracting the SARSr-CoV-2 which causes the disease, CoViD-19. Avoid all human 	contact with people who are not from your household.If you must go out of your home and interact with the public, even at work, then:Stay a minimum of 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people even when shopping.Wear an industrial face mask that contains a gas filter and P3 filter.Wear airtight goggles.Wear nitrile rubber gloves.Wear a breathable hazmat suit.Everything in b to d are cleanable and reusable for many years when cleaned and used according to manufacturer’s instructions. You are highly unlikely to be caught by the virus outdoors providing that you practice physical distancing of 2 meters. That is because of the excellent ventilation properties of the wind. Bear in mind, that virus laden aerosols can hang about in the air for up to 15 minutes. A fabric/cloth/medical face mask alone, will only prevent you from touching your face. These masks cannot prevent you from being caught by this or any other virus. Under normal conditions, there are three main ways for a virus to enter the human body, these are through the: EyesMouthNostrilsWhenever possible, after you’ve been in a contagious situation: Wash your hands with washing up liquid/dish soap.Wash your face and any other exposed body parts.Don’t wear your outdoor shoes indoors, includes when at work.Don’t wear your outdoor clothes indoors, includes when at work, unless 	you’re wearing a hazmat suit.Consider having virtual: meetings, parties, weddings, work, play and socialising.
